reviews.review_msg: Avoid this professor, he is tough in grading, vague (you don't understand what he wants in the assignment. I dropped the class because I am sure he wouldn't pass me.
Hate this class, drop out before it is too late.

The most disorganized class you will ever take. There are no due dates or instructions for the assignments and the TAs and prof has different criteria for everything. The word limits for assignments are very short and it is impossible to write stuff that is good, his feedback on assignments is bad and vague. Useless class, skip the profandtakesumme

Vague explanation of assignments + a lack of set due dates  an abosolute mess of a course. I know this was an online course and everything is somewhat disorganized, this course was an absolute mess. Seriously.
So difficult. Little to no help from prof and TA's are so difficult

The most confusing professor, I've had since school went online. His lectures are very long and boring. His assignments are confusing because he doesn't actually give you any guidelines but the worst part is that the word limits on his assignments are way too little. 300 words to finish a whole assignment. 40 pages of reading each week.

A total waste of a class that should be much more interesting, just one hour of class a week where he reads off slides. Rest of the class is dedicated to an unguided conversation that usually goes off topic. 4 major assignments all due at end of semester with vague outlines. Little indication of how well or poorly you are doing by the end of term.
The most disorganized professor ever! He barely explains anything regarding the assignments. Avoid him at all costs.

Incredibly intelligent.  Has such a broad base of knowledge.  Frankly,  he is way too good for this department.  I think this guy could be doing anything he wanted, anywhere in the world.  Not sure why he has chosen SFU but they are lucky to have him.  Great wit on top of his genius.
Great prof, easy to follow lectures and really interesting. Flexible with assignments and helpful with questions.
He is awesome! Funny, friendly, helpful and approachable. Interesting lectures that are clear and straightforward. Very kind professor who cares about his students. I really enjoyed this class!
A easy prof to follow. Made Canadian politics interesting and linked it to current events. Not a hard marker.
I liked this professor. My first globalization class and it was excellent. Very helpful and not a hard marker provided you study he is very flexible.
Excellent Teacher, liked his attitude to let students approach the material the way they feel comfortable. Very helpful.
Haven't ever taken a course of his but I used one of his works as a reference in my thesis. incredibly intelligent man with lots to stimulate the young mind. Highly recommended.
Liked him; went to him with an issue for my paper and he was super-helpful and not a hard marker.

The ideal professor.  He will help you if you ask him, and he will ignore you if you want to just sit in the corner and get a B.  People that dislike him are either uptight and dislike his tangents, or are daft enough that they fail to recognize his tangents are entirely connected to the material.  Smart and honest, and treats you like an adult.

Took over for Heard halfway through the term. He wasn't able to hold the class' attention (his accent + his long examples) but his lectures were funny and informative. I think he probably would be better at a less general, higher level course though.
Pretty fair marker, if you go to office hours he is very helpful. Wants you to work for your grade but lets you pick a topic of interest to you
Good, funny professor. Recommended.
He is super interesting but a bit tougher than other profs in the poli sci department.  I usually get A's easily in 3rd year poli sci classes but he made me work for mine.

Interesting lectures but he doesn't expect you to attend all the time.  He does not give a lot of feedback on essays and midterms but is always willing to talk you through assignments and give suggestions after class or at office hours.  Easy marker.

gotta love this guy.. most easy prof i've had at SFU. his italian accent is awesome and he goes off on tangents about how corrupt the italian government is LOL got an A, missed a few lectures.. no real point in going to class either as he gives out the notes.
Too many small assignments and has these quizzes that ask you the tiniest details from the dense readings.  Doesn't seem very interested in teaching and very picky on written assignments.

This is definitely the worst Prof I have experienced in 3 years at SFU. He does not stick to his office hours.He also doesn't answer emails. I asked him repeatedly to provide feedback on my work to no avail. He should NOT be teaching!
Migone doesn't care about teaching. Doesn't answer emails or give students any of his time.  Would never take one of his classes again.

Prof. Andrea Migone is a horrible online instructor.  He spends no time interacting with students and his marks seem to be completely random  as he provides NO feedback or criticisms to help you improve.  I have met him and he seems passionate about politics, but he should be stopped from ever teaching online courses.

The worst prof I have had at sfu.  The class was online and he was entirely absent.  After repeated requests for feedback on the term paper and suggestions for sources, I could only get him to respond by insinuating that I would complain to the department. Though well informed his bias is obvious. He should stick to research or leave academia.

I had him a while ago.  Very tough on plagiarism, even if it was unintentional.  Lectures off of his power points and goes off on tangents.  Not too exciting, not totally hard but definitely no room for slacking off.
A good professor, requires more analysis than your average teacher here. Was very helpful to me when I went and saw him during office hours.

One of my favorite profs. If you are legitimately interested in understanding Poli Sci this is the guy for you. If you are just trying to sail through your degree with the minimum amout of effort you will not like him.
I loved this teacher. Very approachable. Got him to look over my essay before I handed it in, ended up gettin an A in the class despite getting a low mark on midterm. =) Am waiting to take him again!
haha freaking A all the way, boring lectures, sends out the notes online, just read the notes...gets off topic like crazy but he's a good guy

He's the worst prof at SFU.  He is very intelligent but doesn't seem to be able to relay that information to his students.  Focus on your paper and your MT and you can do well.  Just make sure to cite everything!
Although Migone did attempt to make the subject more interesting, there is no point to attending lectures. Just read the texts and memorize the powerpoints for the midterm.
good prof. his power point work is great. very approachable and ready to discuss problems. my second class with him and I would readily take another.

Hey is a great research prof yes, but what people need to understand about this man is that he focuses on research to help you understand the concepts presented in the course and to take it further. Attending lectures yes, are useless to go to.

Andrea is a great prof. the time and effort he put into his power point presentations is very useful. My impression is that he cares a great deal about student achievement. This is my second class with him and I would take another.
Andrea is all over the place.  He is really research focused.  You might as well just read the text and work on your papers instead of attending class, such a waste of time.

He's an interesting professor but if you actually want to learn about IPE, I suggest you take the course with another prof.  He lectures off powerpoint and doesn't really try to engage students at all. He turned an interesting course into a waste of time.  He is obviously a very capable academic but it would be nice if he cared about his students .

This prof is awesome. one of the best profs at sfu. He is an easy marker and  his exams are easy and he is fair... The prof is very open and flexible. i am taking a second class with him and am enjoying every second of it. cant wait to take another class with him. Take him you wont regret it. Awesome prof. do ur readings and u are in the clear

well, where to start....His exams are a complete joke!!! i think he just opens the text book and pick the first thing he     reads.. he can spend two weeks talking about a concept in class and then not have a singe question on that on the exam!!!

A capable professor, but his lecture style is very dull, and he is unable to graps and maintain students' attention. He is knowledgeable, but had difficulties explaining much of the course material to us.
VERY good class, geared towards expalining a difficult topic; easy to do well in.

YIKES! This is my fourth poli sci class and my interest has taken a huge nosedive! Prof is booooorrring. Goes off on history tangents. Intentions are good as he wants you to understand the history of anything political, but he ends up loosing the class. Good thing is that his exams are a joke (very short! quiz size) and he's an easy marker.

Nice character. he is fun and has a nice approach to an otherwise boring subject. He used the text quite a bit, the questions for the exams were straight out of it. Impossible to do poorly if you prepare normally.

Difficult to understand at times (thick Italian accent) - but funny.  VERY limited class notes, test material is straight out of text (but verrry specific and nitpicky).  Class attendance basically non required, need to read textbook...DO NOT reccommend this class with this professor.

Nice guy, but his lectures are a joke. We literally learn nothing, so lectures are very skippable. The midterm was absurd (just a bunch of random questions) and the textbook doesnt help at all. The memo project seemed really hard, but it was marked pretty easily. Overall I regret taking this class and its probably the worst class I've taken so far.
Didn't learn anything from the lectures. Did well in the course by just reading the textbook. Going to lectures is pointless and they are very difficult to comprehend. Worst prof. I've had so far.

Andrea is a swell guy. He is so funny. I went to class just for the stories. I did not really learn to much, which might make some mad, but i thought it fun nonetheless. His marking is easy. He seems left-wing, but when you talk to him, he really isn't. Readings are pointless, ur not tested on them. Most of his classes have no final.YAY 4 ANDREA!!!

Migone is a great professor, despite the comments below. He is hilarious, and had the class in stiches quite often, in a class about THE CANADIAN BUREAUCRACY!  Without him that class would have been horrible - he led it well, and actually made it interesting.  He is left wing, but admits to being so very clearly.  I would love to take him again.

He pontificates on the evils of anything even remotely right-winged or moderate.  He is totally biased, has irrelevant lectures, and is a radical left wing zealot.  If you're not insanely in love with socialist atheism, this prof is not for you.  If you have to suffer through his lectures bring a pillow.

I don't think there's a point to his lectures; extremely unstructured, no AV whatsoever. No overheads, nothing. Readings are irrelevent. Some comments made in class by him were fallacious, and I did x-reference. At this point, I can't really trust anything he says. I feel like I've lowered my intelligence by forcing myself to sit through his class.

This guy is very nice, funny at times, however, his class is extremly boring, does not teach well, text is irrelevant in my opinion. If you want to sleep take his course but the boredome is not worth the sleep. Marking is fair, not easy not too difficult, he is young so he might just improve with time.

Not only a great prof, but a really great person. Brings alot of colour and flavour to what he teaches through his own experiences. He really got me thinking about bigger issues. I really enjoyed the class.
Horrible. Not clear at all in his lectures and he goes on and on about nothing in particular. Want a sleeper? Take his class.

I didn;t mind his class. He makes things interesting by telling stories and bashing americans. Not much point to do readings though, and lectures were sometimes pointless. But overall I think hes not a bad prof
No Comments
Male, not female, professor. Boring lectures, little relevence to text, does not engage the class. Fair marker. But he is a young instructor and will hopefully improve.
